prerequisite: You must have an active PSTN (landline) phone line from Nepal Telecom.

application_step: Visit your local Nepal Telecom office (the one managing your landline).
Submit the official ADSL subscription form.
Mention if your phone line has 'Home Metering (16 KHz)' facility.
Nepal Telecom reviews technical feasibility (takes up to 7 days).
If feasible, you will be contacted for initial payment.
After payment, you receive your username, password, and connection instructions.

critical_warning: If your phone line has Home Metering (16 KHz) facility, you must mention this during application. You will need to purchase and install a splitter that supports Home Metering, otherwise this feature will stop working after ADSL is activated.

service_activation_note: NT will provide the broadband service within 7 days of application, based on technical feasibility.

equipment_note: Subscriber must arrange the CPE (Customer Premises Equipment - ADSL 2+ modem/router) with splitter from the local market. NT does not provide CPE.
equipment_responsibility: Installation, configuration, and maintenance of the CPE is the sole responsibility of the subscriber.

billing_options: Customer can subscribe on a Monthly basis or on a Volume (prepaid data pack) basis.

service_policy: The services are available on a First Come First Serve basis.

post_subscription_action: Subscriber must configure the purchased modem with standard NT settings.
